en: I will be friendly to him even if he doesn't like me.
ko: 걔가 날 싫어해도 난 친절하게 대할 거야.

en: Don't trust him, whatever he says.
No matter what he says, I'll never believe him again.
ko: 걔가 무슨 말을 해도 다신 안 믿어.

en: She believes him, whatever he says.
ko: 걔가 무슨 말을 하든 그 여자는 다 믿어.

en: Let him be a great statesman, I don't admire him.
ko: 그 사람이 훌륭한 정치인이라 해도 난 존경하지 않아.

en: Even if he doesn't come here, I'll go on waiting for him.
ko: 걔가 안 오더라도 난 계속 기다릴 거야.

en: I have to go even if it rains cats and dogs.
ko: 비가 억수같이 쏟아져도 난 가야 돼.

en: Even if pigs were to fly in the air, I would believe her.
ko: 해가 서쪽에서 뜬다 해도 그 여자 말은 믿을 거야.

en: I will go, be the weather what it may.
Whomever you may ask, you can't get a satisfactory answer.
ko: 누구한테 물어봐도 만족스러운 대답은 못 들을 거야.

en: Whoever telephones, tell him I'm out.
ko: 누구한테 전화 오든 나 없다고 해.

en: No matter who says so, I don't believe it.
ko: 누가 그렇게 말해도 난 안 믿어.

en: Whoever may say so, I don't believe it.
ko: 누가 뭐라고 해도 난 안 믿어.

en: Even if there is a convention, I shouldn't ask them for so much money.
ko: 관례라 해도 그렇게 큰 돈을 요구하면 안 되지.

en: I will go even if it should rain heavily.
ko: 비가 많이 오더라도 난 갈 거야.

en: Even if the sun were to rise in the west, I would not change my mind.
ko: 해가 서쪽에서 뜬다 해도 내 마음은 안 변해.

en: If the sun were to rise in the west, I would never agree to your plan.
ko: 해가 서쪽에서 뜬다 해도 네 계획엔 절대 찬성 안 해.

en: If the sun were to rise in the west, I would not break my word.
ko: 해가 서쪽에서 뜬다 해도 난 약속 안 어겨.

en: I always buy a top quality product even if it is slightly more expensive.
ko: 좀 비싸더라도 난 항상 제일 좋은 걸로 사.

en: I have a watch that is nice, if not new.
ko: 새 건 아니더라도 꽤 괜찮은 시계가 있어.

en: A watered down compromise resolution is better than none at all.
ko: 부족한 타협안이라도 아예 없는 것보다는 나아.

en: If he fails, so what?
Even if you have your own way, you will not always be successful.
ko: 네 마음대로 한다고 해서 항상 성공하는 건 아니야.

en: If not confidently, at least hopefully.
If I am dull, I am at least industrious.
ko: 내가 좀 둔하긴 해도 부지런하기는 해.

en: Even if we do this, it will be another sixty years before the Antarctic ozone hole is repaired.
ko: 이렇게 해도 남극 오존홀이 회복되려면 60년은 더 걸릴 거야.

en: Even though I was right, he got the best of me.
ko: 내가 맞았는데도 걔가 날 이겨 먹었어.

en: Even if I am wrong, you are not quite right.
ko: 내가 틀렸다고 해도 너도 딱히 맞는 건 아니야.

en: Even if he is in trouble, Mac is always optimistic.
You have another chance even if you fail this time.
All people can become friends, even if their languages and customs are different.
ko: 언어와 관습이 달라도 누구나 친구가 될 수 있어.

en: Even if you make great efforts, you won't be able to achieve it.
ko: 아무리 노력해도 그건 이루지 못할 거야.

en: Granting you were drunk, I cannot excuse you.
ko: 취했다는 건 알겠는데 그렇다고 용서가 되진 않아.

en: Even if you stop me, I won't change my mind.
ko: 네가 말려도 내 마음은 안 변해.

en: Whatever you may say, I will not change my opinion.
ko: 네가 무슨 말을 해도 내 생각은 안 바뀌어.

en: Even if you don't like music, you'll enjoy his concert.
ko: 음악을 안 좋아해도 걔 콘서트는 즐거울 거야.

en: He didn't like to ask for help even if he was starving.
ko: 걔는 굶어 죽을지언정 도움 청하는 건 싫어했어.

en: Even though he is learned, I can't respect him.
ko: 그 사람이 박식하긴 해도 존경하진 않아.

en: No matter how cold it is outside, the rooms are comfortably heated.
ko: 밖이 아무리 추워도 방 안은 아주 따뜻해.

en: I'll follow you, come hell or high water.
ko: 무슨 일이 있어도 끝까지 널 따라갈 거야.

en: Go through fire and water.
Even if I have to sell my house, I'll keep my business going.
ko: 집을 파는 한이 있어도 사업은 계속할 거야.

en: Live where she may, she always enjoys her surroundings.
ko: 어디 살든 그 여자는 항상 잘 지내.

en: No matter what you may do, you must do your best.
Even when she thought about something else, ideas of death returned to her mind.
ko: 다른 생각을 하려 해도 자꾸 죽음이 머릿속에 떠올랐어.

en: Whatever happens, you must keep calm.
No matter what may happen, I am always prepared for it.
ko: 무슨 일이 생기든 난 항상 준비되어 있어.

en: Don't change your plans, whatever happens.
ko: 어떤 일이 있어도 계획 바꾸지 마.

en: No matter what happens, you must be here by nine.
ko: 무슨 일이 있어도 9시까지는 여기 와야 해.

en: No matter what happens, I am prepared.
I will go cycling even if it rains.
ko: 비가 와도 자전거 타러 갈 거예요.

en: Even though it is raining, he will play golf.
ko: 비가 오는데도 그 사람은 골프를 칠 거래요.

en: Even if it should rain, I will start tomorrow.
ko: 설사 비가 온다고 해도 내일 시작할 거예요.

en: I will go there even if it rains.
I have to go even if it rains.
Even if it rains, I will start early tomorrow morning.
ko: 비가 와도 내일 아침 일찍 시작할 거예요.

en: Even if it rains, the game will be played.
Even if it rains, I'll start.
The game will be played even if it rains.
The soccer game will be played, even if it rains.
ko: 비가 와도 축구 경기는 열릴 거예요.

en: Even though it is raining, I don't care at all.
Even if it rains, I'll go swimming tomorrow.
ko: 비가 와도 내일 수영하러 갈 거예요.

en: Even if you are not to blame, you should apologize.
Such poets as Toson and Hakushu are rare.
Ball games, such as basketball and ping-pong, are usually played indoors.
ko: 농구나 탁구 같은 구기 종목은 보통 실내에서 해요.

en: For instance, bowing is peculiar to us, the Japanese.
ko: 예를 들어 절을 하는 건 우리 일본인들만의 독특한 문화예요.

en: Take, for instance, your family problems.
ko: 예를 들어, 당신의 가족 문제를 생각해 봐요.

en: How many samples, for example?
ko: 예를 들면 샘플이 몇 개나 있나요?

en: For example, he speaks German, French and English.
ko: 예를 들어 그는 독일어, 프랑스어, 영어를 해요.

en: For example, Koko was asked to choose a house or a tree for shelter from the rain.
ko: 예를 들어 코코는 비를 피할 곳으로 집이나 나무 중 하나를 고르라는 요청을 받았어요.

en: For example, they do not have to go to a stadium to see the World Series or the Super Bowl because they can enjoy watching the games in their own living rooms.
ko: 예를 들어, 월드시리즈나 슈퍼볼을 보러 경기장에 갈 필요가 없어요. 거실에서 편하게 볼 수 있거든요.

en: Whatever story I tell, Mother believes me.
ko: 내가 무슨 이야기를 해도 엄마는 다 믿어주세요.

en: No weather was severe enough to keep him indoors.
ko: 어떤 날씨도 그를 집에 머물게 할 만큼 험하지 않았어요.

en: She paints every day no matter how busy she is.
ko: 그녀는 아무리 바빠도 매일 그림을 그려요.

en: No matter how long it takes, I will finish the job.
ko: 얼마나 오래 걸리든 이 일은 끝낼 거예요.

en: However hard you may study, you can't master English in a year or so.
ko: 공부를 아무리 열심히 해도 1년 정도 만에 영어를 마스터할 수는 없어요.

en: Try as you may, you can't do it in a day.
ko: 아무리 노력해도 하루 만에 할 수는 없어요.

en: No amount of money can buy happiness.
ko: 아무리 돈이 많아도 행복을 살 수는 없어요.

en: No matter what happens, I won't change my mind.
ko: 무슨 일이 있어도 제 마음은 변하지 않아요.

en: Whichever you choose, you cannot lose.
ko: 어느 쪽을 선택하든 손해 볼 건 없어요.

en: Whichever bus you may take, you can get to the station.
ko: 어떤 버스를 타도 역에 갈 수 있어요.

en: Wherever you may go, you can't succeed without perseverance.
ko: 어디를 가든 끈기 없이는 성공할 수 없어요.

en: Go where you will, you can't hope for success without effort.
ko: 어디를 가더라도 노력 없이는 성공을 바랄 수 없어요.

en: No matter where you live, you would find it difficult not to laugh at, say, Charlie Chaplin's early films.
ko: 어디에 살든 찰리 채플린의 초기 영화를 보고 웃지 않기는 힘들 거예요.

en: There are few, if any, such men.
ko: 그런 사람은 설령 있다고 해도 아주 드물어요.

en: Even if it is true, it matters little.
Even if you do not like it, you must take charge of it.
Even if the performance is good, I still say we drop the project.
ko: 성과가 좋더라도 이 프로젝트는 중단하는 게 좋겠어요.

en: You must do it even if you don't want to.
Even though you don't like this, you must eat it.
Even if I were rich, I wouldn't give money to him.
ko: 내가 부자라고 해도 그 사람한테는 돈 안 줄 거예요.

en: You must do the work, even if you do not like it.
Whenever you visit him, you will find him playing video games.
ko: 그를 찾아갈 때마다 항상 게임을 하고 있을 거예요.

en: The millionaire insisted on acquiring the masterpiece no matter how much it cost.
ko: 그 백만장자는 가격이 얼마든 그 명작을 사겠다고 고집했어요.

en: Even if you go far away, let's keep in touch with each other over the phone.
ko: 멀리 가더라도 전화로 계속 연락하며 지내요.

en: No matter where you go, I'll follow you.
Even if it takes you three years, you must accomplish your goal.
Even if it costs 10,000 yen, I must buy the dictionary.
ko: 만 엔이 들더라도 그 사전은 꼭 사야 해요.

en: Even if it takes me ten years, I am determined to accomplish the job.
ko: 10년이 걸리더라도 이 일은 꼭 해낼 거예요.

en: Were the sun to rise in the west, she would not change her resolution.
ko: 해가 서쪽에서 뜬다 해도 그녀는 결심을 바꾸지 않을 거야.

en: Even if you boss attacks you and tells you to go away, you should make your point.
ko: 상사가 몰아세우며 가라고 해도 네 할 말은 해야 돼.

en: I want to get the word out - even if you don't have a lot of clothes you can enjoy dressing more fashionably by mixing and matching.
ko: 옷이 별로 없어도 믹스매치만 잘하면 패션을 더 즐길 수 있다는 걸 알리고 싶어.

en: There is no accounting for tastes.
Tatsuya has some friends who live in New York.
ko: 타츠야는 뉴욕에 사는 친구들이 좀 있어.

en: Because we'll all fall down on the cold ground.
ko: 우리 모두 차가운 바닥에 쓰러질 거니까.

en: Because you're a sweet and lovely girl.
They live there.
The lights went out just now.
I heard a shot just now.
I've just finished my work.
I want you to take back what you said just now.
A fishing boat put off just now.
I've just come back.
It began raining just now.
I only just saw the accident.
I was just mugged.
Only one little daughter did they have.
ko: 그들에겐 어린 딸이 딱 한 명 있었어.

en: Not a single word did he say.
ko: 걔는 단 한 마디도 안 했어.

en: A mere 529 spectators watched the game.
No more than 50 people came.
They're only $50 with two cans of shoe polish free of charge.
ko: 구두약 두 통 서비스로 해서 딱 50달러야.

en: It took little more than an hour.
You just messed up once. You don't need to agonize over it.
ko: 그냥 한 번 실수한 거니까 너무 괴로워하지 마.

en: It only costs $10.00!
Could you tell me the way to Madame Tussaud's?
ko: 마담 투소로 가는 길 좀 알려주실래요?

en: A dachshund is a dog from Germany with a very long body and short legs.
ko: 닥스훈트는 몸이 아주 길고 다리가 짧은 독일 개야.

en: Dachshund sausages first became popular in New York, especially at baseball games.
ko: 닥스훈트 소시지는 뉴욕에서, 특히 야구장에서 처음으로 인기를 끌었어.

en: An ostrich does not fly through the air.
Ostriches are incapable of flight.
The ostrich has wings, but it cannot fly.
An ostrich can not fly any more than a kangaroo can.
ko: 캥거루가 못 나는 것처럼 타조도 날 수 없어.

en: The panic spread through the district in an instant.
I could see nothing but fog.
Just keep on walking.
You should never look down on a person merely because he is poor.
ko: 단지 가난하다고 사람을 무시하면 안 돼.

en: You have only to believe him.
Just imitate what he does.
ko: 그냥 걔가 하는 대로 따라 해 봐.

en: You can just call me Taro.
All you have to do is to cultivate the ability to put yourself in the other fellow's place.
ko: 상대방의 입장에서 생각하는 능력을 키우기만 하면 돼.

en: Some read books just to pass time.
ko: 그냥 시간 때우려고 책 읽는 사람들도 있어.

en: She left me simply because I had a small income.
ko: 그녀는 단지 내 수입이 적다는 이유로 나를 떠났어.

en: We have a visitor right now. Would you mind waiting for a while?
ko: 지금 손님이 계셔서 그런데, 잠시만 기다려 주실래요?

en: We are currently experiencing some turbulence.
We are full just now.
They are merely different.
Fine words butter no parsnips.
ko: 말만 번지르르한 건 아무 소용 없어.

en: Merely to breathe does not mean to live.
ko: 숨만 쉰다고 해서 살아있는 건 아니야.

en: He could do nothing but watch.
We can but wait for the results.
ko: 우린 그저 결과를 기다릴 수밖에 없어.

en: He is just pulling your leg.
One can no more write good English than one can compose good music, merely by keeping the rules.
ko: 규칙만 지킨다고 좋은 영어를 쓸 수 있는 건 아냐, 좋은 곡을 쓸 수 없는 것과 마찬가지로 말이지.

en: You've just been down in the dumps.
ko: 너 그냥 요즘 좀 우울했던 것뿐이야.

en: Only one careless mistake cost the company millions of dollars.
ko: 부주의한 실수 딱 하나 때문에 회사가 수백만 달러를 날렸어.

en: I was waiting all alone.
My sole idea was to get there as fast as possible.
ko: 내 생각은 오로지 최대한 빨리 거기 가는 것뿐이었어.

en: The only way was to ask her for help.
ko: 방법은 걔한테 도와달라고 하는 것밖에 없었어.

en: The only solution is for her to give up the plan.
ko: 유일한 해결책은 걔가 그 계획을 포기하는 거야.

en: You never get something for nothing.
You can't get anything for nothing.
ko: 아무 대가 없이 얻을 수 있는 건 없어.

en: One mistake will cost a person his life.
ko: 실수 한 번에 목숨을 잃을 수도 있어.

en: You probably just have a cold.
ko: 너 그냥 감기 걸린 걸 거야.

en: It's just a trick of the wind.
How about giving me a promotion from just-a-friend to boyfriend?
ko: 그냥 친구 말고 남친으로 승격시켜 주는 거 어때?

en: I would hate to become just a housewife.
Not a word did he speak.
You may have it for nothing.
It was bad enough that he usually came to work late, but coming in drunk was the last straw, and I'm going to have to let him go.
ko: 평소에 지각하는 것도 문제였는데, 술 취해서 출근한 건 진짜 선 넘었지. 이제 걔 내보내야겠어.

en: You can have this book for nothing.
I just felt like hearing the sound of your voice.
We must act at once.
I want you to go to Osaka at once.
ko: 너 지금 바로 오사카로 가 줬으면 좋겠어.

en: We must carry out the plan at once.
ko: 이 계획을 당장 실행에 옮겨야 해.

en: He just drones on and on but hardly even touches on what we need to know for the test.
ko: 걔는 계속 주저리주저리 떠드는데, 시험에 필요한 건 거의 얘기도 안 해.

en: If it does not rain.
However, you have to queue...
All that I was looking for was somebody who looked like you.
ko: 내가 찾고 있었던 건 그냥 너 같은 사람이었어.

en: He lost his position just because he refused to tell a lie.
ko: 걔는 그냥 거짓말하기 싫어해서 직위를 잃었어.

en: The line is busy now. Please hold the line.
ko: 지금 통화 중이야. 끊지 말고 기다려 봐.

en: The line is busy now.
He's gone to Nagoya on business.
We're out of stock now.
I will be with you right away.
They are now sitting in conference on that question.
ko: 걔네 지금 그 문제로 회의 중이야.

en: Appear before us now.
The line is engaged.
I'm home, Mom!
He came only as a witness to the light.
ko: 그 사람은 그냥 빛을 증언하러 온 거야.

en: I just wish we could leave this horrible place.
ko: 그냥 이 끔찍한 곳을 떠날 수 있으면 좋겠어.

en: He who is afraid of asking is ashamed of learning.
ko: 질문하기를 두려워하는 사람은 배우는 걸 부끄러워하는 거야.

en: I think it's worth asking.
I don't want to be made a cat's paw.
ko: 난 남 좋은 일만 시키고 싶지 않아.

en: I think that it was probably Friday of last week.
She is not pretty, to be sure, but she is very clever.
ko: 걔가 확실히 예쁜 건 아닌데 진짜 똑똑해.

en: Indeed he is rich, but he is not reliable.
ko: 걔가 부자인 건 맞는데 믿을 만한 사람은 아냐.

en: It's true that there are fewer children due to the falling birthrate, and there are fewer children in the school, but that is all to the good.
ko: 저출산 때문에 아이들이 줄어들고 학교에 학생 수가 적어지는 건 맞는데, 오히려 그게 더 나아.

en: Flying a kite can be dangerous.
The kite went upward.
The octopus is in the sea.

ko: 그 뒤로 그 사람 소식은 들은 적이 없어.

en: I had never seen a more beautiful sight.
ko: 그보다 더 아름다운 광경은 본 적이 없었어.

en: Have you any further questions?
You can't expect more than that.
Beyond that I cannot help you.
ko: 그 이상은 나도 도와줄 수 없어.

en: I couldn't bear any more insults.
ko: 더 이상의 모욕은 참을 수 없었어.

en: You won't find a better job in a hurry.
ko: 급하게 이거보다 나은 일자리를 찾긴 힘들 거야.

en: He led a hard life after that.
ko: 그는 그 뒤로 고달픈 삶을 살았어.

en: I haven't seen her since then.
ko: 그 뒤로 그녀를 본 적이 없어.

en: I cannot take less.
It is far from easy to understand it.
ko: 그걸 이해하는 건 결코 쉽지 않아.

en: We need some clues to understand it.
To understand it, you have only to read this book.
ko: 이걸 이해하려면 이 책만 읽어보면 돼.

en: It's the animal in me that wants it.
ko: 내 안의 본능이 그걸 원하고 있어.

en: Let it be done by six this evening.
Send it by mail.
Will you send it by mail?
Please bring it back tomorrow.
It was careless of her to forget it.
ko: 그걸 잊어버리다니 그녀도 참 조심성이 없었네.

en: Just wrap it up.
Let's get it over with.
Let me hear it.
I am sad to hear it.
It made my blood boil to hear that.
ko: 그 말을 들으니 피가 거꾸로 솟는 것 같았어.

en: When she heard that, she turned pale.
ko: 그 소식을 듣고 그녀는 얼굴이 창백해졌어.

en: As soon as he heard of it, he hastened to the spot.
ko: 그는 그 소식을 듣자마자 그곳으로 달려갔어.

en: She felt like crying upon hearing that.
ko: 그녀는 그 말을 듣고 울고 싶어졌어.

en: I'm very sorry to hear that.
I'm very glad to hear that.
I'm sorry to hear that.
I am indeed very glad to hear that.
My resolution was shaken when I heard about it.
ko: 그 얘길 들으니 내 결심이 흔들렸어.

en: I'm sorry to hear it.
I sighed with relief to hear it.
ko: 그 소릴 들으니 안심이 돼서 한숨이 나왔어.

en: I am very much relieved to know that.
ko: 그 사실을 알고 나니 정말 다행이야.

en: I'm so sorry to hear that.
